critique: The document focuses on the efficient allocation of resources during wartime. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and security that the war effort is being handled effectively. There is also an element of hope that the project will contribute to the war effort and ultimately lead to victory. The language is formal and authoritative, which reinforces the sense of control and competence. There is little to no indication of negative emotions such as sadness, fear, disgust, or anger. Surprise is also not a primary emotion being conveyed.
